title: Cognitive Load During Problem Solving: Effects on Learning
summary: Working memory is limited. Learning and performance are hampered when 'extraneous' load (bad design, distractions) competes with 'intrinsic' load (the task itself). Good design minimizes extraneous load.

effectiveness_metrics.description: Reducing extraneous load directly improves the capacity for processing the actual task.

mechanisms.name: Split-Attention Effect
mechanisms.description: Avoiding the need to split attention between disparate sources of information.

mechanisms.name: Germane Load Optimization
mechanisms.description: Directing mental effort toward schema construction (learning).

actionable_strategies.name: Minimalist UI Mode
actionable_strategies.application_in_app: During a focus block, strip the interface to the bare minimum (e.g., just the timer) to reduce extraneous cognitive load.

actionable_strategies.name: Single-Tasking Mandate
actionable_strategies.application_in_app: Never show a list of 10 micro-activities. Show exactly one option with a 'Shuffle' button to prevent decision fatigue.
